entities.description: The use of substances such as tobacco, alcohol, and drugs.
The state of mental well-being and any mental health disorders a person may have.
The treatment received for substance use or mental health issues.
The economic standing or condition of an individual or household.
The highest level of education attained by an individual.
Geographical areas that are located outside towns and cities.
Availability and accessibility of healthcare services.

relationships.description: Indicates that the respondent uses substances such as tobacco, alcohol, or drugs.
Indicates that the respondent has a mental health disorder or issue.
Indicates that the respondent has received treatment for substance use or mental health issues.
Indicates the economic status of the respondent.
Indicates the highest education level attained by the respondent.
Indicates that the respondent resides in a rural area.
Indicates the availability and accessibility of healthcare services in the rural area.
